Synonyms.Synonym: Solitary fibrous tumor of the pleura

QAPair.Question: What is (are) Mesothelioma - benign-fibrous ?
QAPair.Answer: Solitary fibrous tumor (SFT) is a noncancerous tumor of the lining of the lung and chest cavity, an area called the pleura. SFT used to be called localized fibrous mesothelioma.

QAPair.Question: What causes Mesothelioma - benign-fibrous ?
QAPair.Answer: The exact cause of SFT remains unknown. This type of tumor affects men and women equally.

QAPair.Question: What are the symptoms of Mesothelioma - benign-fibrous ?
QAPair.Answer: About one half of the people with this type of tumor do not show any symptoms. If the tumor grows to a large size and pushes on the lung, it can lead to symptoms, such as: Chest pain , Chronic cough, Shortness of breath, Clubbed appearance of the fingers ,

QAPair.Question: How to diagnose Mesothelioma - benign-fibrous ?
QAPair.Answer: SFT is usually found by accident when a chest x-ray is done for other reasons. If the health care provider suspects SFT, tests will be ordered. These may include: CT scan of the chest , Open lung biopsy , Pulmonary function tests , The diagnosis of SFT is difficult compared with the cancerous type of this disease, called malignant mesothelioma , which is caused by exposure to asbestos (as cancer needs to be ruled out). SFT is not caused by asbestos exposure.

QAPair.Question: What are the treatments for Mesothelioma - benign-fibrous ?
QAPair.Answer: SFT is usually treated by removing the tumor.

QAPair.Question: What is the outlook for Mesothelioma - benign-fibrous ?
QAPair.Answer: The outcome is expected to be good with prompt treatment. In rare cases, the tumor may return.

QAPair.Question: What are the complications of Mesothelioma - benign-fibrous ?
QAPair.Answer: Fluid escaping into the membranes around the lungs ( pleural effusion ) is a complication.

Question.qtype: when to contact a medical professional

QAPair.Question: Do I need to see a doctor for Mesothelioma - benign-fibrous ?
QAPair.Answer: Contact your provider for an appointment if you notice symptoms of SFT.
